UJIwkZiJV76qOjAqMgMSnA.text: The cocktails are Awesome! still to try the Food. Staff are nice and friendly and prices are not that bad.   Would go again :)

MXjGmjNOASYluc-RL_lSKQ.text: TGI Friday's is located in Castle Street in Edinburgh, which is just off Princes Street's western side.   There is a waiting area beside the door which you may well need to use as it can get very busy at peak times and you may have to wait for a table.   TGI Friday's is an American themed restaurant so expect well trained barmen shaking cocktails and friendly, hands-on service.   I last visited with my daughter and she ordered from the childrens' menu, having a 3oz fillet steak with chips and peas for 4.99 while I opted for a burger, having a cheese and bacon burger which was delicious.   TGI Friday's menu is predominantly meat and burgers with some pasta dishes. They use a Jack Daniels sauce and marinade on many dishes - this however is not to my taste. I was disappointed to see no fillet steak on the main menu too.   You can get some incredible cocktails at TGI Fridays and I can attest to the quality having had a Long Island Iced Tea on a previous visit which was fantastic.   Pricewise this place isn't too bad - my burger came in at 9.99 and the entire meal for myself and my daughter including soft drinks was less than 20, which considering the quality of the food was excellent value for money in my opinion.

gkyDmNgndJJEjLlhSukXMA.text: Got the ribs, good stuff!  ( my gf got burger, not so good) she got thr cocktail too, huge but just ok. Waited ages to get table, ( think we got skipped) but waitresses was v nice

TWFVUmUXBH1Qdq50IFBOKg.text: Not the best place to go if you're on a halal/vegetarian diet, but they do some great vegetarian desserts. The staff are brilliant! Really friendly and so accommodating. A fantastic place for a reasonably priced meal with friends or family. Excellent for kids!

ThXIRlchi0vXYYTivL86UQ.text: They really try and give you an experience here, the portions are decent and the food is okay. I wish it could be a bit cheaper but maybe I'm still in student mode!

JLLtMeO2fiY6qxhoKMh8GQ.text: The food here is pretty good, as it is in all the TGI rstaurants. Due to the location, this tends not to get quite as noisy and packed as the hardrock cafe which is about a five minute walk away.

nRWUKELfRI6tpTAlqdFFOw.text: A night out here is great fun, it has one of the best cocktail menus around and the food isn't half bad either. Because of its name you perhaps pay a little more than you would do somewhere else but personally I don't mind this as the atmosphere in the restaurant is always lively and entertaining. A great Saturday night starting off point, not for those looking for a quiet one though!

paIJRd-KlDagHbCrq7_TJA.text: Good American-style food, not for those on a diet. However, when myself and some work colleagues went in a month or two ago we were disappointed by the service. It took nearly an hour for our main course to show up and then 20 minutes for dessert. Rather disappointing when it's supposed to be fast food and it wasn't all that busy then either.

rOgRFEYdllCxPBTV8UBIcQ.text: Great location and fab food and service , kids are well catered for and well worth trying a cocktail. Staff are always very friendly and some great memorabilia around the venue.

VaoeXdCGgbxLewd2C7Dy8g.text: TGI Friday's vary in quality but thankfully this is one of the better ones we've been to. The portions are awesomely sized as usual and both the burger and onion rings I had were really excellent. Wife had a fajita thing which smelt good and she enjoyed it.   Milkshakes were a bit stingy though, they appear to have stopped filling them to the top of the glass now, which sucks.   Friendly and attentive service but getting a table was a bit slow, which is forgiveable considering it's fringe season right now.

rtu27YQsTGJ7zIc8QAr0MA.text: I absolutely love this place. My boyfriend and I love diner style places and this is head and shoulders above the rest. This is due mostly to the cocktails though!! The food isn't amazing, but if you're going specifically to TGI's it's probably just what you're in the mood for- meat covered in BBQ or JD sauce! But, aye, the cocktails! Everyone must have a Gremlin before they die. We tend to sit at the bar after our meal for a couple of drinks, and the barsmen are always chatty and helpful. I have had my own cocktail made on more than one occasion. The barman asked me 3 things I like in a cocktail, and he made it up to my spec right in front of me! OH, and my boyfriend accidently ordered just a banana milkshake, and it was the most amazing ever created. Please get one!

9jY-ZgUPam-v_L9quM5WDg.text: Very good food which is all an american diner kind of theme. All the staff are extremely friendly and the price is also very good. During the week i think you can get two courses for a tenner which is very good value especially considering the location, right next to princess street. Very easily accessible obviously and millions of bars and pubs nearby.

TLM-e0EM3rKgazK4Nxf_DQ.text: Love this place. Food is good. Staff are excellent and have time for the kids/

jX3yGR4GUzygCdAUHNP1CA.text: OH MY GAWD.i know i have rambled on about the places i love but this is one of the best.I guarantee you that if you visit you will have a meal you will never forget. They have affordable prices, amazing cocktails which are made in front of you if you are the bar. I would suggest the Raspberry Watkins or the woo woo. They are delish. they also have non-alcoholic ones which are just as good..And once you get to the meal, oh my..there have an amazing Jack Daniels sauce which i felt like taking home with me.i even asked for more, but anyway if you start with the Mac and cheese bites which are divine.Then the Rib's which are a huge portion but i challenge anyone to be able to not finish them.OR the Jack Daniels chicken which has a cheesy delicious mash and fresh vegetables.After all this you still have desert but i didn't have enough room but i had enjoyed the first 2 courses that i simply had to get something else before i left..IF you go for a birthday let the staff know as they have a special bday jingle they sing..they're also very friendly and definetly always deserve a tip!!!

uuoyZQSAYkpaeoKSA0jygQ.text: Good food at a good price, the service is a little slow, but the food is worth the wait and all the staff are friendly. I would recommend the burgers and the milkshakes (keep in mind a milkshake with an ice cream sundae from here is a sickly combination, although separately fine). An interesting place to eat, particularly if your company is boring as there is plenty to look at. They are happy to sing happy birthday (there are even two different versions, one for kids and one for adults - the latter involving the words 'someone here is getting old') but you should be prepared for some embarassment as they tend to make you stand on the spiral staircase in the middle of the restaurant as they announce your birthday to the room and sing to you. A nice place to eat whether it's a casual lunch or a celebratory meal.

M_I7MnuWjggEH7Jg37aUNA.text: We ate here whilst on holiday in Edinburgh.   We were seated immediately and ordered drinks. They don't do any alcopops so that was a disappointment for me. I had a cocktail instead which was lovely. The kids ordered cokes and the soft drinks were bottomless however no one ever came to ask for a fill up and my husband went to the bar himself for it. The restaurant wasn't busy so I thought they could have been more attentive.  The food was lovely though and its a very comfortable place to sit and eat.

ThYN4r_6Eoww_vwyna4BbA.text: I'm not a big fan of American food like this chain.  But I wanted to compare this and Hard Rock Cafe and see which has better quality food.   The good news is, TGIF beats Hard Rock in all aspects.  The atmosphere is generally relaxed and seats all spaced out.  I feel that in Hard Rock cafe, it can get a little bit too crowded at times although everyone is sitting down.  There are also partitions between sets of tables and high walls which separates every group.  It feels more personal and more intimate.  Area wise, there are bigger seating space and there is a bigger bar area which is perfect.  Hard Rock Cafe bar area is just too small for those waiting for their tables.  For food wise, I think there are generally not much difference, both serve about the same type of food but i think TGIF do have better and more tender meat than Hard Rock.  That said, it's good but not the best.

photos.caption: Photo of TGI Fridays - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of TGI Fridays - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of TGI Fridays - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

WHXWYL2oEaFeeXFFKHPhHQ.text: Service was decent.  Never were offered refills.  Maybe if we had a different waitress.  Nacho plate was not what we expected, I would recommend against it, very pricey and we didn't really like it.  Very little chicken.  Our lunch was very good which is why we didn't complain.  Some what pricey.

ineY5y5cTBcoomw2Y3CoQg.text: Good Service, friendly staff. Food was excellent good and served fast. Music was a bit loud. Very nice furnitures for excellent privacy during your stay!

photos.caption: Photo of TGI Fridays - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Burgers and Mozzarellasticks. Sauce was delicious

kKgIZncriHWhnpV0pq_fMg.text: Two stars and that's really just for the cocktail.   This review won't be full of oooohs & ahhhs and other surprises.   To me, this is just another chain doing standard run of the mill attempts to get American diner experience. I don't get it.   Service was ok, the food came all hot and the were no problems. The beef chilli nachos barely had any beef chilli - I was expecting a little mound but instead got little flakes.  The taco tower was ok - nothing that really sang to me.   Overall from this and a past experience people will have to drag me in for food as I'm not convinced.

SVSg3IxRj54E1zw6nqVeMQ.text: I used to love going to TGI Fridays, because they used to have the menu where it was 2 courses for 9.95. My friends and I used to go for birthdays and the staff are always great and you'd never have any complaints because you knew exactly what you were getting.  However, there seems to be some kind of East/West discrepancy. TGI Fridays in Glasgow would get bstars, or maybe even flour, but TGIs in Edinburgh is lucky to be getting two stars.  The staff were great, but I had mixed up the booking and had booked the table for a day later than required, but they sorted us out. It took us ages to pick from the menu, I ordered buffalo wings. I love buffalo wings. I do. They're my favourite ever thing from TGIs but in Edinburgh...THEY DON'T PUT SAUCE ON THEM. I was traumatised. I was unsatisfied.   I ordered a chicken burger next and found it unbearably salty. I don't usually have TGIs burgers, and I don't think I will again if they're this salty.   My boyfriend shared his Oreo sundae with me and that was really good, so that's why I'm giving this place two stars.

0Uxj7Fmv13N1LsARcxSEwg.text: If you really need to visit an American chain restaurant while you're in Edinburgh, please do yourself a favour and walk a little bit further down George Street and go to the Hard Rock instead. This is possibly the most disappointed I've ever been going to a restaurant in Edinburgh. I've had better service and food from an airport TGI Fridays. We made a reservation despite probably not needing to. The waitress seemed disinterested, the cocktails were expensive and weak, the burger was overcooked, the wings were overpriced, and the onion rings were cold. There are very few places that I've ever sworn off going to again, but this is one of them.

OBLPGDX8anGv6PGFOaTb_w.text: American Grill  Oh yes there was a time it was 'hip' and 'cool' to eat at TGI Friday.  That was about the time that those words were frequently used to mean exactly that. The concept has not changed, consumerism happened. There are places that do steak to perfection. Burger Bars that serve culinary masterpieces and for chicken wings there is only ONE place - and this ain't it.  Sure, burgers, fritters, wings and a steak, finished off with a Sundae - who can say no to that.  Well not many people, but guess what, some places to it better, tastier and .. *gasp* .. classier.  I appreciate the atmosphere they try to convey, and the service is great, cheerful and attentive (part of their briefing I know, but feels genuine)  nothing wrong there. I like the location and certainly the money off special deals they have at times.   What I don't like is the flavour, it is lacking that umph. There is no real heat in hot sauce, no satisfaction in the peppered steak.. oh, and the cola float .. well you get the idea that these are not the droids you're looking for.   It is catered to kids, not to the older ones, but the tiny tots that just outgrew the buggy are in the "I can do this myself, mummy" stage. The drinks are geared to this demographic : sweet and colourful.  The portion sizes are of a similar ilk. I am not a big eater, but my eyes do like to feast on size of portion. My experiences are a mixed bag and all on the small side. No lack of colourful produce, but small sizes and free of any flavours that may offend parents, toddlers and alike.   I just hope that some day it would be cool AND pleasant to eat here, because at the moment I avoid the place as much as I can.

RpiWh0HUTwvyDlZx0Ihw6g.text: Very accomodating staff as my party of 12 was delayed so we pushed the booking time back twice on the night.   Good range of comfort food along the lines of what you'd expect in an American Diner combined with good meal deals and swift service make for a pleasant and unpretentious night out.

3dUcWC_jdRTo4n2lGDuLng.text: short review for a short visit!  the boyfriend and i stopped in here briefly while waiting to hear where to meet up with his friends later.  i did notice that the place seems to be have revamped since my last visit a few years ago and the bar area is definitely much better with booth seating along one side and proper high chairs at the bar.  we ordered two drinks, mine was an amaretto sour and the waitress brought them over to the table.  the amaretto sour was a perfectly nice drink and my boyfriend enjoyed his drink as well, but overall i'm not super excited about tgi fridays.  while i do crave that sort of american type food every now and then tgi fridays seems almost a little bit dated and under par compared to the rest of the edinburgh dining scene.  there are definitely worse places, but so many more places that are better for drinks or dinner!

m-2gYylaqkjkz1E38igydA.text: I wish people would stop slating places like TGI's. The amount of shite I hear along the lines of "it's so soulless" and "it's not locally sourced" really gets on my wick. I also love cosy little restaurants, but on the other hand, there are few meals in the world more satisfying than a half rack of ribs along with some blackened Cajun chicken and a side of onion rings.   This branch provides the same fattening, delicious feasts as all the rest, and like the others, has undergone a minor facelift of late in order to bring it into the 21st century. The staff have toned down the over-friendliness that failed to disguise their obvious self-loathing and feelings of worthlessness, the decor has been made marginally less brash, and the menu returned to glories past.   So stop pretending you're too cool or alternative to like it, and embrace TGI's for the genius that it is.

b7qoifWxhQ1xhx3ujkVgbw.text: I had a friend who used to work here, and she would eat off the plates when she was taking them away....that used to freak me out.  So this is your bog-standard TGI Friday's. To be honest, the atmosphere on a Friday is decidedly less as exciting as I would have expected. I've been a couple times and my over-all reaction is 'meh' . I think that sums it up. If you're looking for chicken wings, chilli-burgers, nachos and ribs, then you've hit the jackpot - but otherwise.....meh  The cocktails were quite sickly too, but I got a free glass out of it. I am easily bought, and a huge TGI Friday glass did the trick.

HXTHLvMWZVCxF_BwNEivTw.text: Ugh... I hate this place. Seriously hate it. I went in for a friends birthday, her choice clearly...as soon as I saw the menu I was filled with disappointment. Nothing on here isn't fried, like nothing. I'm surprised even the menu wasn't presented to you fried. Honestly the food is SO cheap & nasty I could go to lidl & pick up something better. Its REDICULOUS prices too, for what you get.... there are so many lovely restaurants (even the snobby upper class ones) that charge less than this... 13 for a crappy burger... seriously?! My food came out swimming in oil it was jut so greasy I wanted to go home & have a shower afterwards.  The only saving grace as the staff, which I cannot fault at all, service was spot on, friendly & attentive... i'm sorry to give you guys a low score as you were all working so hard & I know its a chain so staff have no control over the menu, but the food is just horrible & I would not recommend this if it was the last place to eat on earth.

CpgVs6gl8L7rI3iba0ffDA.text: Poor old TGI's it's not doing too well on Yelp so I though I should put in my tuppence worth about my dining experiences here which have all, bar one been nothing other than fantastic. The one occasion where it could have been a bit better I was with a large group and one of my friends orders was completely forgotten about, so she had to watch, drooling while the rest of us scoffed down out meal - oops. The mistake was rectified as soon as we pointed out to one of the waitresses.  You know what to expect from TGI's; burgers, nachos, ribs, chicken wings and their chips which are especially delicious even though the portions could do with being a little bit more generous.   It is quite pricey but great if you're looking for American food and especially great for families/birthday parties or if you're with a big group as it always has a great atmosphere. I like TGI's now and again for a wee treat, especially when I can't be bothered with getting all dolled up to go to a nice restaurant. Good old TGI's.

kDmpVpVHGGzB0P3WunVp-A.text: Yack.   Same crappy food they serve in the States except smaller portions, cooked in more fat and more expensive. Cocktails not much better either.

jlQ45l3pZWeZd568WdqSAA.text: I hear staff in TGI Fridays do a lot of training before they get to be a fully fledged waiter. I don't know whether this is True or not, but if it is it is time to rethink their training programme. No matter what TGI's I go to the service is always crap. Especially in this one.   Hi miss waitress person I have been waiting to place my order for twenty minutes. Stop walking past me and lowering your eyes so I can't attract your attention. Oh Mr waiter guy, your service was completely awful that is why we didn't leave you a tip. You proved I made the right decision when you angrily asked where your tip was.   I do quite enjoy TGI's food though. I know I shouldn't because we all like to turn our noses up at them and it's the same in every restaurant, but it is my kind of food and it goes down a treat. That's why it gets an extra star.   One more thing, I only like the food when it is on the lunch deal so it is cheap. If I paid full price for it I would rethink my decision to like it.

wNeMSDM11ekOybEi4f9eog.text: I love this place so much the staff are amazing. Food it so yummi and fresh. A very enjoyable Dinning and social experience. It's just one of those places where you just have a good vibe.

wtHYrT17ufj2EeF6xYTaKg.text: Big enough to accommodate a dozen of us on short notice (i.e we phoned as we were walking down the road!) with excellent service. The staff are always excitable and chatty, hoping diners have as much of a good time as a good meal.   The food itself is fantastic for what you're expecting, although you do pay for it. A brilliant hungover dinner, especially with the free refills and wonderfully greasy menu and super sweet desserts.   Not to be done too often, especially for a 'nice meal out' but certainly a restaurant that can be relied upon regardless of the day of the week or time of dining.   one waiter 'refused' to bring out one of our party's blue steak, which he was quite apologetic about, but he could have arranged this with another member of staff and not made a song and dance about it in front of our table.

syhspcWYIEfAKQGoVXXHgg.text: To be honest I have never really liked this TGI's - I have tried it a couple of times but much prefer the one in Glasgow. The staff are nice and try their best but a few times I have been they have had things on the menu that they haven't been able to produce and I have ended up being recommended something else which is not so nice at all. I know the staff are probably told - 'if they order this then push this instead' but if it isn't as good why bother? And it is quite expensive for what it is. I can get a decent burger somewhere else for the same price rather than a substandard one from TGI's.  It just seems good these days for parties and events.

8CKBFPpgrIO-O089deV8Og.text: I have to update my review here, because although I believe we visited TGI's Edinburgh on a bad day, I went again a few days ago for a quick lunch and I had a gorgeous burger which was served with a smile. Stacked with cheese, mozzarella dippers and crispy bacon, it was so yummy! The waitress was so nice to us (perhaps she's had a read of the reviews on here) and we left thoroughly satisfied. So I'll up my review by a star because really, sometimes, TGI Fridays is just the perfect comfort food.
